123.author: by Teddy Slater ; illustrated by Franc Mateu.
notes: Based on motion picture Alice in Wonderland.
Summary: A little girl falls down a rabbit hole and discovers a world of nonsensical and amusing characters, where manners are baffling and rudeness seems to be the rule.

124.title: Walt Disney's Dumbo and the Magic Feather : a Book about Confidence.

125.title: Walt Disney's Peter Pan Saves the Day : a Book about Bravery.

126.heading: Disney's Classic Value Stories.
126.title: Walt Disney's Pinocchio Learns the Truth : a Book about Honesty.
126.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Retells the Pinocchio story, focusing on when Pinocchio first leaves home to go to school and learns the hard way that lies are not good to tell or listen to.
"Based on the Walt Disney motion picture Pinocchio."

127.heading: Disney's Classic Value Stories.
127.title: Walt Disney's Snow White Finds a Home : a Book about Helping.
127.author: [No author]

128.heading: Disney's Classics.
128.title: Cinderella
128.author: adapted by Jan Carr.
notes: "Based on Walt Disney's full-length animated classic."
Prose with black and white stills.

129.heading: Disney's Classics.
129.title: Walt Disney's Classic the Little Mermaid
129.author: based on Disney's full-length animated movie ; adapted by Jan Carr.
notes: Summary: Ariel is a beautiful mermaid who longs to be human. Her father, King Triton, has always told her that humans are bad, and he is angry when she falls in love with a handsome human prince named Eric. In order to win the Prince, Ariel makes a bargain with the evil sea witch Ursula and her slimy eels, Flotsam and Jetsam. They will make her human, but she must give up her voice. She then has three days to get Eric to kiss her, or she will turn back into a mermaid.

notes: Summary (from OCLC): While working for S.H.U.S.H., J. Gander Hooter disappears after asking Darkwing and his sidekick Launchpad to solve the mystery of who is erasing the ink on money everywhere.

notes: Radio scripts for Deutschlandfunk programs on Disney comics in Germany, including material about comics translator Erika Fuchs.

141.title: "Disney's Donald Duck Uses the 'F-word' in New Cartoon : Wal-Mart Pulls Video from Shelves" p. 1, 12 in The Unreported News
141.author: [No author]
notes: Reference is to a story called "Clock Cleaners."

142.heading: Disney's Doug.
142.title: Doug Makes the Team
142.author: story by Nancy Krulik ; illustrated by Matthew C
142.appears_in: Peters, Jeffrey Nodelman, Vinh Truong, Brian Donnelly, Miriam Katin.
notes: "Original characters for 'The Funnies' developed by Jim Jinkins and Joe Aaron."
Summary: Doug tries out for the soccer team. He becomes the mascot. But when Patti sprains her ankle, he goes in and wins the game.
Children's book based on an animated television series.

143.title: Disney's DuckTales.

146.heading: Disney's DuckTales.
146.title: Dinosaur Ducks.
146.author: [No author]
notes: Spine title: Dinosaur Ducks and Jungle Duck.

Summary (from OCLC): In "Dinosaur ducks," Scrooge thinks to take dinosaurs to his zoo, but almost loses his life. In "Jungle Duck, " Mrs. Beakley, Scrooge, and the nephews search for the Silver Bird and meet Jungle Duck, who is really the lost Prince Greydrake.

150.author: [No author]
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Uncle Scrooge and his three nephews search for the location of the fabulous Giant Pearl, unaware that they are being followed by Flintheart Glomgold and Magica de Spell.

151.heading: Disney's DuckTales.
151.title: Journey to Magic Island

153.title: The Secret City Under the Sea

notes: Summary: Scrooge McDuck, Gyro Gearloose, and Huey, Louie, and Dewey go in a submarine to search for the lost city of Atlantis.

155.heading: Disney's DuckTales.
155.title: Webby Saves the Day.
155.author: [No author]
notes: Summary (from OCLC): While Huey, Dewey and Louie are staying with their Uncle Scrooge McDuck, robbers break into the mansion, but the babysitter's young niece Webby catches the Beagle Boys.

156.heading: Disney's DuckTales.
156.title: Welcome to Duckburg.
156.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Huey, Dewey, and Louie help get one of Uncle Scrooge's treasures back from the Beagle Boys and L. Capitan.
MSU Library copy lacks cassette tape.
